properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 2:52AM EST until January 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW EXPECTED IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE
NORTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MOUNTAINS...

.An upper-level disturbance will track from eastern Kentucky
southeast through eastern Tennessee and western North Carolina
today. Temperatures will be cold enough at the higher elevations,
mainly above 3500 feet, for snow accumulations of 2-4 inches with
locally isolated amounts of 5 inches. Below 3500 feet, snow
accumulations are expected to be mostly less than 2 inches.
Additional snow accumulations will be possible this evening and
overnight as upslope snow showers develop across the mountains in
response to increasing northwest winds.

* WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations 2
to 4 inches, with isolated amounts up to 5 inches. Winds gusting
as high as 35 mph later today and tonight.

* WHERE...In Virginia, Grayson County. In North Carolina, Ashe,
Alleghany NC and Watauga Counties.

* WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Slippery road conditions can be expected, primarily at
elevations above 3500 ft.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor snow accumulations will be possible
at lower elevations, but accumulations in these areas are
expected to be less than 2 inches and confined more to grassy
areas.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST TUESDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
